p: The chemical composition of the P-EO samples was analyzed by gas chromatography (GC) using a Perkin Elmer gas chromatographer (PerkinElmer Inc, Waltham, MA, USA) equipped with a flame ionization detector (FID) (PerkinElmer Inc, Waltham, MA, USA). The working conditions were as previously described in Predoi et al. [ 33]. Furthermore, a GCâ€“MS analysis of the P-EOs was done with the aid of a PekinElmer Turbomass Quadrupole mass spectrometer (PerkinElmer Inc, Waltham, MA, USA), as previously described in Predoi et al. [ 33]. The compounds were identified with the NIST and Wiley Registry 8 Edition mass database, n-alkalene (C 9-C 22) hydrocarbon series (Nile, Italy), and the mass spectra found in the literature [ 59, 60] as comparative elements. The results of the chemical composition were presented as relative area percent (%).
